title: Usopp's Elbaf Dream Will Be Fulfilled
theory: Episode 72 marks the first time Usopp expresses his dream to visit Elbaf, inspired by the warrior spirit of Dorry and Brogy. Fans theorized for over 20 years that Usopp would eventually reach Elbaf and achieve his dream of becoming a brave warrior of the sea like the giants he admired.
author: One Piece fan community
statusNote: This theory was confirmed when Usopp finally reached Elbaf over 1000 episodes later in the series.

title: Usopp Will Gain a Giant-Related Power in Elbaf
theory: Building on Usopp's admiration for the giants established in Episode 72, some fans theorize that Usopp will eventually eat a Devil Fruit in Elbaf, specifically a Mythical Zoan 'Hito Hito no Mi, Model: Elbaf' or 'Hito Hito no Mi, Model: Giant', allowing him to transform into a giant or gain giant-like powers. The theory suggests that the giants pray to a warrior god named Elbaf, which could be the basis for such a fruit.
author: Various fan theorists
statusNote: This theory remains speculative and has not been confirmed in the series.

title: The Sacred Duel Represents Ancient Giant Culture
theory: The century-long duel between Dorry and Brogy shown in Episode 72 represents the ancient warrior culture of Elbaf and the honor code that all giants follow. Fans theorize that this duel is a microcosm of the larger themes that will be explored when the crew eventually reaches Elbaf, including the importance of honor, warrior pride, and the tension between traditional warrior culture and modern pacifism.
author: One Piece analysts
statusNote: The Elbaf arc has confirmed that giant culture values honor and warrior traditions, though the full scope is still being explored.

title: Mr. 3's Cunning Foreshadows His Later Importance
theory: Mr. 3's scheme to sabotage the giants' duel in Episode 72 demonstrates his strategic mind and cunning nature. Fans theorized that despite being defeated in the Little Garden arc, Mr. 3 would play important roles later in the series due to his intelligence and tactical thinking rather than raw power.
author: One Piece community
statusNote: Mr. 3 later becomes an ally and plays crucial roles in major events including Impel Down and Marineford.

title: Elbaf Connection to Norse Mythology
theory: The giants introduced in Little Garden, including Dorry and Brogy, are connected to Elbaf which is based on Norse mythology. An 8-year-old Reddit theory by user Lycantree suggested that Elbaf is built on or around a massive tree (like Yggdrasil from Norse mythology), potentially the same giant tree from the Skypiea arc. This theory was inspired by the world-building established in episodes like 72.
author: Lycantree (Reddit user)
statusNote: The Elbaf arc has confirmed Norse mythology influences, though the tree connection is still being explored.
